Title: none
Review_Text: Only problem. This model cannot be synced to Xfinity voice command remotes. Xfinity does not have a compatible code to synchronize to their remotes yet. You have to use tv remote for volume control. This is an Xfinity problem not a TCL problem so may get corrected someday
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great TV for the price! No complaints!
Review_Text: Haven't been using this TV for too long, but so far it has been amazing for TV and video games. The audio seems better than I expected for TV built in speakers. The picture comes in really clear and the TV is extremely user friendly!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great price great tv. I made a great choice
Review_Text: I purchased my tv a few weeks ago. It was delivered on time and still in great condition. Tv works perfectly fine. Sound is great. Colors are great. So I went back and purchased this same brand tv just a 65 inch. Which is now mounted in my living room. Hope this review help someone. Have a blessed day everyone.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: great value for all primary features
Review_Text: most cost-effective TV on the market. I have both 65" and 75" for two conference rooms in my office.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Decent first leap into the 4k world
Review_Text: So I basically got this to support my xbox series x.. The picture is great and the ease of setting it up and having it up and running so quickly was a plus. The sound is good but I will definitely be getting a soundbar to give it a little something extra. The remote is very simplistic and gets you to the apps and the volume but I wish there was a menu button because getting to the accessibility section to change even the smallest thing is a daunting task. Just be sure you have a tv stand long enough to support it if you aren't going to wall mount because i upgraded from a 57" to this tv and had to order and build a new one long and deep enough to accommodate it.. Other than that, happy with the purchase.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great TV!
Review_Text: I bought this TV because I wanted a TV to be the size of the wall in my small living room in a condo. I loved this TV but ended up returning it for a couple reasons. 1) It was too big. Never thought there would be such thing as too big, but it was. The living room is small so the TV felt too big. I felt like I couldnt take in the whole picture as I should. 2) I installed a wall mount and The TVs mounting holes are not centered but on the lower portion of the TV back. It made it mount a lot higher than I intended. A TV this size would be great for a larger size room where the viewing space is at least 12ft. away from the TV. This TV is great for the following reasons. - Roku TV has a lot more customizations and features - Roku allows you to pause live TV by adding a USB. - Seems to be faster and more stable than the Android TV. - Roku app to control the TV. Android tv has no phone options at all. - Too much to mention. If youre debating on an Android TV vs the Roku. I suggest the Roku. The Android option seems like a newer option but the Roku has so many more features. Some of the Roku TV brands offer you the option to use voice control with the Roku TV. The photos show a 55" Android TV on top and the 65" Roku TV below.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great TV for the money
Review_Text: TV arrived safe and sound, the plastic straps which hold the box together, and are coincidently used to for hand holds, were digging into the box - but held up well. TV was sufficiently padded with Styrofoam and held securely in place. I am a fan of the Roku interface and a previous good experience with TCL led me here. TV booted up, updated, and then added the appropriate channels. HDMI Arc connection worked like a charm so my soundbar was happy. I can't speak to the onboard speakers, but I am sure the onboard sound is good enough. I highly recommend the TCL Roku 4 series 65: TV!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: What a steal of a deal!
Review_Text: My old plasma tv was on its last leg, and I was so excited to replace it because the glare on plasmas is VERY annoying. But which brand to buy? I'm a senior and tech challenged so I didn't know what Roku is, or the difference between QLED and LED. Due to the Covid 19 stay at home orders, my local Walmart was sold out of every brand except the 43inch TCL Roku. And it was on sale for $208! I figured I couldnt pass up the price and the store clerk said it would be returnable within 30 days. So I get it home, very easily plugged in but i forgot my Internet provider login. Had to call COMCAST, but i lucked out and got a service tech who had two TCL's in his house and loved them. So not only did he reset my PW, he also showed me all the great apps and how to change settings/subscriptions, etc. I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS TV! The screen clarity is perfect, love the remote, and I honestly couldn't be happier. I only wish I had gotten one of these TVs sooner! Hundreds of apps, each with a boatload of tv shows and movies. There are movie channels for everyone, from classic b
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Good While It Lasted....

Either way, i didn't bother to return the tv because i felt like maybe it wont be too much of a problem. I should have returned it. When i woke up this morning, it looked like this (see pictures). Im not sure what happened there but now i have no TV. The TV was wonderful while it lasted. Great picture and size. Love that i can access Netflix and Youtube without have to Chromecast. If I want to cast to the TV, i can just do it without buying anything additional. It makes life easy. Looks like there are a few others who are having trouble with receiving damaged TVs. Title: underwelmed

Title: A great TV at a great price!
Review_Text: An absolutely great TV! I bought this on 12/29/19 to replace an old Samsung 32" Smart TV (2012 model) that crapped out on me (network card died, so it turned into a dumb tv, otherwise it still worked). The picture quality and size of the display are absolutely stunning and much better than the one it replaced. The Roku interface is a breeze to use and works great for my needs. Remote is very simple and easy to operate. I've had it for almost 3 months now, and absolutely no problems with it so far. When I went to buy it I did not know the time it was on Rollback until I went to pay, so I was surprised to get a pretty good deal on it! Overall, very satisfied with my purchase, and would definitely recommend this to someone looking for a new TV.

Title: Please Do Not Buy This 75S425
Review_Text: I had purchased two of these TCL - 75" Class 4 Series LED 4K UHD Smart Roku TV at the same time. One lasted 42 days and the other one 87 days, both the exact same issue, black screen no video. I was lucky enough with the first one in that I was able to return it and send it off for repair to eventually have it replaced with a new one, however after the second one stopped working I had to work with TCL support and the lowest bidder for local on site repair. Long story short, I bought a new LG 75 after dealing with that. Please avoid this purchase; I am kicking myself now for not reading the bad reviews. As I rarely write reviews and only post when I either insanely love or despise something, I am posting this review out of my own personal ignorance for not doing better research on my purchase. This is not a seller issue, or a distributor issue, it is a manufacturer issue.

Title: Good TV, no AV ports though
Review_Text: It's a perfect TV for streaming. Fit perfectly in the cabinet I have installed in my wall. My only complaint is this model did not have AV ports even though on the box there's three ports pictured. I ended up having to pick up an adapter so I could use my Wii. Felt like that was kind of deceptive, especially since the 40 inch model I bought last year included AV ports. Should be clearly marked especially since older game consoles don't use HDMI. That being said, picture is crisp, TV is light, so easy to put together and set up apps that a child could do it. Will likely buy another model for other rooms later on.

Title: Better than expected, worth every penny.
Review_Text: I'm actually glad I purchased it. Seems it was handled with great care; there were no flaws, no cracked screens, no lines, broken parts, etc. Works perfectly. Also, it arrived WAY sooner than expected; I ordered it yesterday afternoon and it arrived THIS MORNING. I literally woke up and checked tracking and it was already on my porch lol. Walmart still has it arriving tomorrow, but it's already here and in my possession. I did purchase the 3yr Protection Plan as well just for added piece of mind. I'm also just shocked at how large it actually is. I dunno why, but I was expecting it to be a little smaller, but 43 inches is a pretty good size, I'm using it in my bedroom and it's perfect. I actually almost purchased a 50" but I'm actually glad I didn't do it; would have been too much! Anyway, as far as the early arrival, I do believe it also had to do with me having it shipped from my local store; the closer the store that you order it from, the faster it will arrive. Thankful to whoever handled my package because they did a great job and I had no issues. Your mileage may vary depending where you are and whether or not you are lucky enough to end up with careful handlers. Set up was easy; just waiting for my new stand to get here so I can set that up and have the tv on that rather than on the floor for the time being. But it'll be here in 2 more days. I haven't watched television since 2016 so this whole thing is new to me. I consider myself tech savvy though so it's not really an issue and I do feel this interface is easy-going even for someone who isn't tech-savvy. Anyway, I'm satisfied with my purchase. I'll purchase another when I get a bigger place and need something for my living room, but this works perfect for the space that I currently use it in.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Fabulous value!
Review_Text: I am so happy that I bought this TV. We just had it installed today, and it has a beautiful picture, and is easy to use. Even though we have a small soundbar from our previous TV (which was only 24"), we didn't need it, because the sound from this TV was excellent. It is in a small room, so we definitely don't need surround sound or anything similar. In fact, a more complicated sound system would be overwhelming for us. Some reviews criticized the "design," saying that it has a black plastic bezel, which is true, but I really don't care about whether it has a black bezel or a chrome edging. Things like that are totally irrelevant to me. I am watching the program, not the bezel! The picture is not going to compare with a $2,000 TV, but it is light years ahead of anything we have had before, and it is just an amazing value for the price paid. My husband has very low vision due to glaucoma, and he was no longer able to read captions on our former TV, or to really see what was going on. He can see everything on this new TV, without any strain or stress, so this is a life-changing purchase for us. I did take Walmart's extended warranty, just in case anything fails over the next few years, but at only $219 for the TV and about $30 for the warranty, it is nothing short of unbelievable.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great. But not a true native 120 HZ TV
Review_Text: Not a true native 120 HZ. I should have done my research on how different companies call HZ. Different companies use different ways of explaining refresh rate. So the TV has back end software to help compute content into "120 HZ" but it's not actually native 120 HZ. With that said I'm sad it's not native 120 HZ but it's still a great quality product. And for the price?! You can't beat it. Enjoy

Title: Great TV, horrible delivery
Review_Text: I am very pleased with my purchase. Its a lovely TV, The picture is bright and the sound is amazing. The speakers are a 8/10. The navigation and set up is simple. The remote is equivalent to the remote of the roku stick. Very lightweight. I used hello tech through Walmart to mount the TV. They did an amazing job. They had plenty availability and my tech Carlos was very professional. The only CON was the delivery. Walmart was great about notifying me that the TV shipped and expected arrival. However, FEDEX Ground was horrible. I live in a secured multi level apartment building. The driver left the TV in the mail room unattended. I had no idea the TV was downstairs until my neighbor who happened to be checking her mail came and told me. I had no way of getting the TV to my apartment on the 4th floor. This was unacceptable. They lacked professionalism and they were very careless. For this reason, I will not order large products from Walmart again. Very disappointed with delivery and the bottom of the box was open by the time it reached my apartment. I suggest Walmart uses a different courier.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Nice- beware of the white light when TV is off.
Review_Text: This is a great TV. The built in Roku is easy to set up and navigate. Picture is very nice. I gave it 4 stars because there is a white light on the bottom of the TV that is the receiver for the remote commands. When the TV is off this white light is very bright. I bought the TV for the bedroom but because of this light, I had to switch it out with another one that I had in my home.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Poor picture quality - JVC's is better
Review_Text: After trying a WebOS Android TV, I decided that I liked Roku's OS/platform more having used a Roku device. I decided to try the TCL 43" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 43S421. To further confirm my choice, I put this one side-by-side with the the LG 43" Class 4K UHD 2160P Smart TV to compare the two. A question mark for me was if Roku TV meant that it had only the Roku channel as part of the channel list? Or is it using as built-in Roku device? I was happy to find that it is its own platform/OS and looks and feels just like my Roku device that I have enjoyed. PROs: Setup was a cinch. uses a standard wall mount of 100 mm X 100 mm VESA. Ethernet network cable for wired network is also available which is my preference (over Wi-Fi). Easy setup wizard. We were watching our shows in a matter of minutes. Great sound quality. This was setup in our family room which isn't a large room and the built-in speakers did nicely. Channel finder was able to locate about 10 more channels from my antenna than my previous TV as well as the LG TV that I compared it to. The primary subscription channels were readily available: Prime, Hulu, Disney , Netflix, CBS All Access, NBC Peacock, Apple TV. While on over the air antenna, hitting left arrow has a guide for the channels which makes it easy to see the programming schedule and browse the channels. CONs: Fuzzy picture and despite the 60 Hz refresh rate seemed to drop or miss frames for some of the movement. I noticed this while watching the News. Compared to the LG TV, the picture quality was a stark difference. Also, I didn't like how the remote control for the Roku TVs doesn't have any numbers (including this one). We have an antenna on the roof for over the air broadcasts and would have to change channels by way of up or down arrow. Ultimately, I chose to return this TV and go for JVC 43" Class 4K UHD 2160p LED Roku Smart TV LT-43MAW595. I kept with the Roku style despite the missing number buttons on the remote. I am much happier with the JVC TV's picture quality and so far I don't have any regrets exchanging this one for the JVC.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: False Advertisement.. Buyer Beware
Review_Text: Don't buy this TV.. Don't be a fool like I was.. When I was searching for a TV I saw that this has a 120hz clear motion index... Well I'm a fool and I mistook that for 120hz refresh rate. This TV is only a 60hz refresh rate and now my new Xbox Series X is basically a waste of a buy since I can't play games as 120FPS and its no better than my Xbox one.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: It works.....
Review_Text: So far so good. However, when in the store I wanted either a Vizio, LG or Samsung, but they didn't have any of those in stock. So in this size, this was the option I had. That said, I have heard of security concerns with smart TVs, so I have mine set up with no internet, always boot to hdmi 1, which has a roku premiere attached. I'm pretty happy with this setup. I've had it just under a week so I can't speak for longevity. I did buy the 3 year protection plan just in case. But given the choice, I would have picked another option. This TV is ok, but would have preferred Vizio, LG or Samsung.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Budget Friendly
Review_Text: Great tv for those on a tight budget but want a larger tv with Roku already built in makes it a great value. Picture not crystal clear but good quality. I'm comparing it to our previous TV which was a Samsung Plasma TV that started going bad after 12 years.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: none
Review_Text: This tv has a fair picture but the remote does not have numbers so you have to scroll up and down. You have to point the remote a certain spot for it to work and there can't anything obstructing it. If it had a better remote I would have given it a better rating
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Obsolete but for 250$ I guess you get what u pay 4
Review_Text: It will not activate the tiki system has been down all day. I received this tv and cannot do anything while the system is down. I think having to activate the tv is stupid I already have and account why didnt it just ask for that rather then having to activate it and just wait for maintenance to do something. Its been 5 hours and still nothing
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM TCL
Review_Text: My TV came without a power cord, remote, stand, hardware and warranty. TCL hasn't replaced the missing items, and are giving me a hard time about it. I researched TV's extensively before choosing this one, but no one mentioned the horrible customer service. Now, I am. DON'T BUY THIS BRAND. I'm frustrated to the point of tears, as I had already given away my old TV. Now all I have is this useless set, which I can't even plug in. Save yourself the headache and buy a trusted brand.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: It's HUGE and awesome like you want it to be
Review_Text: Walmart does it again, high quality product at low low prices. No one can beat this deal on this planet. Love the extended warranty price also for peace of mind. Ive never had to use it ever. Picture and sound awesome and works flawlessly with my wifi connection .
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: GREAT Smart TV
Review_Text: Needed 2nd TV for bedroom. Ordered and arrived 3 days before expected. Setup breeze (don't worry about Roku trying to collect debit card info - they won't bill you for whatever you don't want). TV feels solid as in well built and so far visual quality is outstanding. GET THE EXTENDED WARRANTY for extra protection. Happy with purchase!!!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Poor remote
Review_Text: I've had it for over 1 month. The TV quality is good for the price but the remote sucks. Its range is narrow and it has to be pointed to the exaction direction to get it work. A 30-year old may be more powerful. The typing method for search feels like 20 year old.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: dont buy
Review_Text: great picture but the remote doesn't work or its the tv you press the remote doesn't work when pressing button or it speed up the show or when browsing same problem it doesn't do anything or it goes fast forward and cant stop it my daughter has one she loves it no problems
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Disappointing, despite some great features.
Review_Text: I had high hopes for this TV, but was ultimately disappointed. First the good: I really like the Roku operating system. It's easy to use. Hundreds (thousands?) of apps that load quickly. The menus are fairly intuitive and their are lots of options to configure the inputs to work the way you want them to. The built in speakers were loud and clear - no need for an additional soundbar. The disappointment came with the picture quality. Bright, bold colors looked okay, but scenes set at night or with a lot of contrast looked washed out. Changing the color / contrast / brightness and contrast settings did nothing to resolve the problem. I ultimately decided to return it a buy another brand TV (that was also more expensive.)
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Actually impressed!
Review_Text: I’ve always had Sony’s snd Samsung tv’s but after an accident with my new Samsung 43 inch in the bedroom (I didn’t like the menu on tv, the remote was awful, the picture wasnt all that either). I came across this tv on CNET and it had good reviews. My husband and I both are pleased
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Best Purchase

Title: warranty honored
Review_Text: DISREGARD. I wrote a bad review of the TCL 55 inch because manufacturer wouldn't honor warranty because I called days after the tv broke. I also recommend purchasing extended warranty from Walmart.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: FOR CORD-CUTTERS, this TV is AWESOME!!!
Review_Text: 1. After scanning for local channels (using an antenna - we're using rabbit ears!), the TV will ask, "Set up Live TV Pause?" That's right: it will PAUSE LIVE TV, just like a DVR/TiVo, once you plug in a 16+GB USB Flash Drive. It also allows you quick replay, which also pops up closed captioning, again, just like a DVR/TiVo So, if you're the one who says, "what did she just say?", you hit the quick replay button, it backs up about 3 seconds, replays the scene WITH CLOSED CAPTIONS! 2. The channel selection shows up a CHANNEL GUIDE, with what's on for several hours for each channel. (Yes, just like a DVR/TiVo - it's the chorus line for this review) 3. Absolutely simple remote control: it's a standard Roku remote, with 4 additional buttons: TV Power, Volume Up, Volume Down
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Happy with my purchase! ^_^
Review_Text: We used to have a same brand TV but a 32". We wanted to do an update so we bought this 65" recently. The box wasn't heavy, the TV was well protected and taking it out assembly was super easy. The quality of the picture/screen is great. I'm completely satisfied with the design, quality and price. I recomend this item.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Well worth the money!
Review_Text: I love this tv we have one in our room and bought one for my mom as well and she loves it. It doesnt run very well off a hot spot but if you have wifi it works perfect! Great buys! Deff recomend this tv!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Good for budget tv

Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Excellent
Review_Text: Its all about the picture quality and this one is outstanding. So easy to set up and use. Light weight no problem to move. Even my old movies have a depth and details I wasn't able to see with a regular 1080 pixel. I always purchase my electronics from Walmart and I am never disappointed with the quality or price. Julie
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: It's okay
Review_Text: We had a Haier that Walmart use to sell. It was the best TV for 4 yrs anyways. It was easy to hook up, but I can't hook my dvr/vcr to it and the picture is darker then I'd like and can't find a way to lighten it in the settings. TV volume is okay, but I use our sound bar instead. All in all, it's okay for the price. I hope it last longer than 4 yrs.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great buy , Average TV

Title: Great price and quality!

Title: TCL

Title: Sound Problems!!!

Title: BIG 65" screen, small price!
Review_Text: It came well-packed, ready to mount and play. So easy to connect to wi-fi and add desired channels. This is my second "ROKU" TV so I was already familiar with the set-up. A new ROKU user wouldn't take any longer to set it up. So easy! Screen is bright with variable settings for picture as well as sound and closed captioning options. I would recommend this tv to anyone looking for a large screen at a low price. I also like the night light feature at the bottom of the screen when the TV is turned off. My other TCL TV also has the light which is a 32" model.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Good enough to buy another TCL!
Review_Text: This is the 3rd TCL TV I've bought over the past couple years for our homes in Ohio and Florida. Decent value, full of features and good quality, decent picture clarity and color. If the need arises for an additional TV or replacement I will consider a TCL TV again.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Crisp clear picture with easy to navigate apps
Review_Text: Very clear picture. Love having all the apps. You still have to pay for all the different subscriptions but it makes it very convenient to switch back and forth. We've only had it for about 6 months and we have had a couple random moments of it freezing on either a black screen or the roku screen. Either resolves itself or we have to turn it off then back on again.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Better than My Samsung TVS in my Opinion
Review_Text: I have been a fan of Samsung everything and have gotten tired of the same technology coming from them. I wanted to try a different brand and this tv is better than a Samsung tv in my opinion. On the Samsung device I had to subscribe to a service to watch world wide news or local news, with this tv so far I know I have ABC 24 which I love. I set it up but haven't had the time to explore everything. I do know it has apps that my Samsung TV's have but I noticed the remote is much easier to use to sign in the apps. In my opinion the sound is better than my Samsung TV's. I have to have the Samsung tv up on 40 or 50 but this tv just like 20 or 30. I'm a fan. I'm happy I branched out. Forget about paying for a name and go with value.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: No cable needed

Title: Looks good but seems "dark" at times

I tried adjusting the color/tint/brightness; but this did not help. I found SVERAL blogs online discussing the same issue.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Excellent value for money

Highly recommend it and I'm buying another one.

Title: Nice TV at a nice price

Title: We love our smart TV

Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Very Nice for The Price. Very HEAVY.
Review_Text: The TV is actually very nice. Very large but my wife loves it. I have it "hard-wired" now. But, initially I was using Wi-Fi. The TV was only about 15 feet from the Router but the picture would get chunky and I would occasionally get the wait indicator while on YoutubeTV. I came to believe that either the wifi antenna in the TV is not that great or mine was just faulty. Nonetheless, thank God it works very well with Ethernet cable cause this TV is HEAVY!!! I just assumed that since most flat panel TV's these days are easily manageable by one person that this one would easy with 2 people; it was not. After all was said and done, I am happy with my purchase. The picture is very nice and the Roku Smart app is very nice to have built in since it prevents having a bunch of unwanted hardware lying around.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Normally TCL is my brand. I still believe.

Title: TCL is a great brand- don't pay more for a name.
Review_Text: This is the second TCL TV I have purchased via Walmart within 3 years. We needed a larger screen TV to replace a smaller Samsung TV that was just too small for the distance it had to be placed at in a new master bedroom. I have been very pleased with the first one I bought and placed in our living room. I was somewhat surprised by how light weight the newest model was compared to the first one and to the MUCH heavier yet smaller Samsung model. TCL has been an excellent, very cost effective and reliable brand for our household uses and I highly recommend it to anyone looking to purchase a smart TV.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Super duper TV!
Review_Text: Awesome Tv! Colors pop, and sound quality is so good that I dont feel a need to always turn the separate home theatre system on. So lightweight that we were able to mount it on our existing stand. Turns ON in an instant and navigating to roku and apps is fast and painless. Did I mention that the setup is problem free, and that the unit is almost all-screen with just a thin border on the outside. Six stars out of five lol, and we will be buying more TCL Roku sets when upgrading our other rooms.

Title: none
Review_Text: I received this TV with free home delivery. Arrived on time and in perfect condition. I mounted it to the wall and it was easy to setup. It has a really nice picture and pretty good sound quality also. Not happy that there isn't any controls on the TV except for power button. Misplaced the remote one day and there was no way to change the channels. Also the remote pretty much has to be pointed directly at the TV , when you are to the side it doesn't work very well. Title: 55S421/55S425 Great Value for Features
Review_Text: I was looking to buy another Sharp 55" Roku similar to this one. For a while the Sharp (Japan) was made by hisense (China) but funny thing is TCL comes so close in quality and features similar to my Sharp. So far so good, originally looking for the 55S421 (walmart model versus 55S425 retail mode) but this one fits the bill.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great TV for the price HDR is really weak !
Review_Text: I was very skeptical when I purchased this TV . I wasn't sure if an entry level TCL will be a good choice but I am pleasantly surprised . The TV has great colors and is bright enough for my place with plenty ambient lighting .It really does excel with HD content . That includes 1080p and 4k . The one Con that I see is that HDR content get pretty dark and almost un watchable . Good thing that I am not a videophile and 4k in itself looks so good on the TV that I ended up disabling HDR altogether. There is a secret menu on the TV that will let you disable HDR and I am so happy that TCL actually included that setting . The ROKU interface is the best thing about this TV. It's so simple and easy to navigate . I don't think that I'd get a better TV in this price range . I'd recommend to upgrade to a point anywhere remote instead of the line of sight remote that ships with the TV. They sell those here at walmart.com for like $20 , you will thank me later. Word of advice if you are mounting this TV, the mounting holes are at the bottom part of the TV , so you'll need to make sure that the mounting bracket that you are purchasing is not peeking form behind the TV. I ran into this issue and to get a different mount .
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: TCL is Fantastic brand
Review_Text: This 55 in is my 4th TCL TV. In my opinion they are the best price/performance manufacturer on the market. Pay attention to what Series You are buying. They are all good, but choice should depend on what room and what u will be watching. For example, for your main room for watching I wouldnt consider anything less than the 6 series. Compares to Samsung's best at less than half the cost. For bedroom watching, the 4 or 5 series are definitely good enough. You can also buy aftermarket long term insurance policies for peanuts in case anything goes wrong. Integrated ROKU is also a big plus. I eliminated all my cable boxes because I can stream everything through ROKU. XFINITY even wants you to eliminate their boxes, they are the ones who told me how. Saving $10 a month per box is a big savings. You really cant go wrong with TCL.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: I recommend but not a fan of the legs
Review_Text: This is a great value. It was super easy to set up. The only drawback are the cheap legs on it that are far apart and flimsy. It would be easy for a child to pull it down. So I went through amazon and bought a kit that allowed it to Stan more firmly with the stand under the tv in the center. Much more stable. I would recommend though if you arent concerned about it being pulled down or if your stand is wide.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Good cheap TV for cable-cutters not for gamers
Review_Text: Negatives It doesnt have VGA, RCA, or USB connections. The HDMI connections often put things in letterbox automatically. The feet on the TV are very widespread and splay out at an angle. You will need a TV tray thats at least 48 inches for the splayed feet. There is not a very good bracket on the back for mounting. on the right hand side of the red Roku display there are large ads which you cant get rid of. Positives: price for value was great. Picture quality is good as is sound. In a small to medium-sized room, you wont need a soundbar. Set-up was easy. Its well-protected in the package with plenty of foam and cardboard. Good cheap TV for cable-cutters.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great tv for the $
Review_Text: Has been a great TV for the $ Roku interface is nice. Easily connected up to the wifi network and has been trouble free for the two weeks i have owned it. Not a problem if you are looking strait on, but a minor nuisance if you see from a bit of a side angle. - color is a bit muted, but still very good for a device at this price point.

Title: Read if you are on the fence..
Review_Text: I put a solid amount of time into purchasing a 75 inch 4k tv. A few of the negative reviews on here almost pushed me away completely. A tv in this price range is absolutely amazing! I have a high end 60 inch 4k Samsung as well. There are things you need to consider before you purchase. Reviews says this TCL doesn't get bright at all, but it'll also depend on the room setting and lighting that shines in. My bay windows are off to the side, and I see very little glare off the window directly across from the tv. If your room is very bright, you may want to spend much more on 4k TVs that get extensively bright. But I also went into the picture settings and tweaked them to where I have the brightness and clarity just about perfect. I also added a 4 year warranty for $99 on top of a greatly priced $700 75 inch Roku TV. That's hard to beat! I also changed my speaker settings to "Theatre" and switched it to Dolby Surround and I was pleasantly surprised! I don't even need my soundbar honestly. I wrote this to help some out that may be where I was. Make sure you check your room environment, and understand you're looking at the 4 series. Of course it won't compete fully with $3000 4k tvs, but to be honest, with the tweaking I did I can't tell a difference. They say the TCL 6 series gets a bit brighter, so if you have the money, you may want that. I'm completely happy with the 4 series! Good day!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: 75S421 is a bargain with great picture

Best feature on the remote is the '*' button, which lets you control the picture settings. I got the 4 year extended warranty for $98 because the standard warranty is only 1 year. This is a great TV for a very low price!

Title: Horrible Support, Trading Broken TV for Broken TV
Review_Text: Purchased in the beginning of the year, because of great size and picture with HDR. I started noticing these dark lighting strips on the screen and notified TCL support. TCL said they were sending out a replacement TV after I sent them pictures. They told me they could only send re-furbished TV's because I bought it over 6 months ago. The TV's would be installed onsite by one of there 3rd party installers. The first TV arrived a few weeks later to the 3rd party installers and was DOA... so they had to send it back. After phone calls to support I was informed they were sending another TV to the installers which would take a few more weeks... When the TV installer received the TV and came over to set it up, the box was trashed and multiply re-taped. After setting up the TV we found the screen wasn't even attached to the frame correctly and light was bleeding through. Also, the HDR function did not work at all, this was tested using an XBOX One X. I had the tech re-box the TV and send it back, after he took multiple pictures of the broken TV for his supervisor. To this day I still do not have a replacement TV, and TCL has sent this to "Supervisor".... just to be straight I'm in my second month trying to get this fixed.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Turn off HDR for better brightness
Review_Text: Very happy with TCL brand tvs and the simple Roku interface. This set was a bit dark for some reason when watching movies, I believe this is because of the auto HDR feature. Even messing with all picture settings, vibrant mode, brightness to the max, everything was dark. If you can access the secret menu by pressing Home 5x RW Play FF Play RW , then you can turn of HDR and I noticed a marked improvement in brightness.

Title: TCL 43in TV defects !!!
Review_Text: Buyer's beware I purchased this TV 43in TCL. I was having shadowing so I was at the store went into the electrical TV section ask for help told them my situation and asked to see floor model guy played around couldn't get TV to stay on he told me to go home and adjust the TV. Well 30 day's later my TV is overheating it was 81 degrees in room it was very hot outside humidity. Well I called TCL 1yr manufacturer is a joke he told me to purchase a fan and put on a TV that was 31 day's old and to wait it out until it goes out my 3yr protection plan told me after a yr they can return TV to them and get refunded in a egiftcard that don't work or a check that cost to cash without bank and TV could go up in price in a yr. Well if I was buyer's make sure you like ur TV within the first 3wks or you will go threw 3 different agency and they all will mess with ur time. Good advice watch ur TV in a high heat about 85 to 90 degrees room temperature and if don't over heat it may pass but I think these TV don't stand higher heat then 78 degrees as mine running at. 88 degrees is what my energy efficient TV is average heat with temperature laser gun gauge. Good luck I purchase a 32in 3 yrs ago and it didn't over heat in my spare room at 95 degrees. So it my TV or the manufacturer of the 43in TCL faulty issues. Thanks
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great TV at Very Affordable Price

Title: Great bargin smart tv
Review_Text: Purchased 2 of these in january of 2019(18 months of ownership at the time of this review). They are an absolute steal at the then price of $499. Roku is easy and amazing to use. These replaced my dated sharp aquos 70”. Excellent for gaming, regular tv or connecting an external harddrive. 4/5 stars due to both tvs seem to have a visable backlight running vertically down the center of the tv, that is visible when a dark or black image is on screen. Otherwise not noticeable. Excellent, inexpensive well built smart tv highly recommend
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Volume leveling issues are very annoying.
Review_Text: Would easily be a 5 star review Except, 1 thing makes this TV annoyingly unbearable to watch. Any app that you use which has commercials, the commercials are AT LEAST 3 times louder than the show. It’s so loud to where you can be watching at a reasonable volume and you will wake up other people in the house late night. It’s only on the roku TV. This doesn’t happen on my Apple TV or fire stick. Super annoying and they need a “Volume Leveling” setting in the audio settings which doesn’t exist. It’s super annoying how loud the commercials get. To the point that I will favor watching TV in another room. Considering returning, as it’s not possible to watch this late at night.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: none
Review_Text: I bought this TV based on price, but it has turned out to be an awesome purchase. Great tuner, easy to tune in free local broadcast stations with a small antenna. Great picture clarity and color selection. Sound is very good and I have played it on loud also. I especially love that I can go to the weather channel, or youtube or Netflix or get local news anytime. For the price this TV is Awesome!!!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Pretty good, but the sound goes out
Review_Text: I overall enjoy this TV for our bedroom in Dec 2019. However, since then, twice it has just lost sound for no apparent reason (no power surge, no putting the sound up to 50 or something, etc.). We had to turn it off/on, then unplug for a few minutes for the sound to reset, I guess.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: nice basic generic tv
Review_Text: nice for very generic capabilities. has a nice pic from further back for older style boxes or games. if you got like an xbox or ps and expect perfect incredible graphics will be below your expectations. when turning on must reassign what is input (hdmi, antenna, cable tv). also kinda dark picture and no adjustable modes. preset only allows dark, medium, bright, ultra bright, very generic.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great value tv with great smart tv features
Review_Text: This is a pretty decent tv, especially for the price that I paid. At $88 this was a steal. I bought it to replace my parents 10 year old junker. They seem very pleased with it, but are somewhat confused by the remote. Does not have true 4k or 120hz capabilities.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Fabulous TV! Does NOT have voice control remote
Review_Text: Vibrant, beautiful colors. Roku is so easy to set up. It even found more air TV and Antenna TV channels than I had before. You can add a 16 GB usb driver to the TV which allows you to start an antenna tv show over and pause it. The Roku remote does not have voice control. * Note that the tv legs do need to be installed going the correct direction. The longer end goes on the front of the TV. Thank you Walmart employees for allowing us to pick this up curbside!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great budget 4k TV!
Review_Text: I am totally pleased with this purchase. I purchased in my local store and was able to select a box that had no signs of shipping damage, and this was conformed upon unboxing. It was perfect after opening. Attached the two feet with ease. As I am a dedicated cord-cutter my connection was through my Fios Giga bit wifi. It found my network immediately and no connection issues were found. I was able to add all my streaming accounts ( Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu without any hassle whatsoever. Picture quality is the best I have ever owned. 4k content is simply incredible. It is the best rendering of TV content I have owned, no question about it! I am more than pleased. I am by no means a "videophile", I just simply comment from an average consumer standpoint. It is far beyond simply satisfied in my opinion. Unless your eyes and expectations exceed mine, you will be immensely pleased! Would buy again and do so with the highest recommendation to others!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Doooooooooo not waste your time or money!
Review_Text: I hate I bought this tv! It will not connect to the internet! I have tried everything even an internet extender. The picture is ok but I can't enjoy any of the apps because it won't connect to the internet! Don't waste your time or money with this crap!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Warning for Antenna Users
Review_Text: It's a pretty good size TV. Menu is not difficult to navigate. The initial setup is pretty straight-forward; however, if you are looking to use the Antenna, do not bother. You will have a black screen with no image. The details panel will have something else than the guide. Signal Icon will let you know the signal but for some reason no sound or video. Oddly, it only happens after shutting down the TV. I have tried every troubleshooting step from powering it off to on all the way to factory resetting the device. The only step that works is factory resetting and re-configuring the TV again, which means taking another 15 minutes of set-up and another few minutes to login to your apps every time. The remote (or app) does not have numerical numbers to change the channel. You will be clicking the up/down button to get where you want to be. I am currently awaiting TCL Support for an answer about
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Left side has a dark side
Review_Text: I loved my 55" 4k TV for about a year, then I started noticing that the left side of my screen would get a dark shadow and then quickly disappear. I thought it was the wifi, then Youtube, or News programs as it didn't happen all the time. Then it started to happen on other programs as well. So I got on Goggle and researched 55" TCL TVs and found that many others had the same issue with this TV. So it kind of sucks as I shouldn't be looking for a new TV right now (didn't get an extended warranty)! I debated between one or two stars but because I thought it was a 5 and turned out to be a lemon, I gave it a kind 2 but a 1 also works!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: DON'T BUY IT
Review_Text: this tv had minimal problems for 2 years and then almost 2 years to the day we shut it off and went to bed. Woke up the next morning to no picture! We still had sound but no picture, tried trouble shooting and calling costumer support and they told us there was nothing they could do after they walked us back through the troubleshooting processes we had already done. You pay a large amount of hard earned money for a television that doesn't hold up for more than a couple years of a few hours of use each evening after work! Would not recommend this product to a friend or a family member or a foe or anyone for that matter! This company is terrible!!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Best tv ever
Review_Text: I absolutely love TCL TVs. I bought this one today but previous to this one I own another 42 inch TCL which I have had for 7 years without any issues with it. That one is now in my bedroom and this new one is in my living room. You can't go wrong with these TVs. They last years and get all the new updates!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: none
Review_Text: I purchased this from Bj's at cyber Monday 2019. It was $380 $40(2 years extended warranty). It has enough of at App Store. It is not true 4K , it's an HDR which is as good as 4K that you can not be understand the the difference with your eyes. You will need a long Tv table for that, measure your room and table before buying it. You will need an also a large living room to watch it, otherwise it gives too much led light what causes you less and not quality sleep at long term. I do recommend this Tv.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Don't be surprised
Review_Text: Do not waste your time. If you buy this online Walmart will sell it to an in store customer before one of their own picks it up from the floor. You still get charged until it is refunded; probably 7-10 days. It is similar to airlines overbooking flights. You will get an email with an apology. As a company that states they want to help seniors avoid covid exposure they are completely ridiculous. I bought this item 6 times today. Each time it was canceled. I hate to say this is what you would expect from Walmart, but Im not shocked. Also, enforce your mask requirement.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: One of the best on the market
Review_Text: I have had this tv for 3 years, it has been flawless. We are retired, so we turn it on in the morning and it plays all day. Picture is great, no problems with anything. I bought it on the recommendation of the electronics guy at Walmart. I knew nothing of the TCL brand, but he sure did. He told me they had very few problems with them, less than some of the more expensive brands. I decided to try TCL and I'm glad I did. I highly recommend this brand.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Backlight failed after two years.
Review_Text: Purchased this TV two years ago. Recently the backlight failed. I feel that a TV should last longer than two years. It's not worth repairing because the cost is more than buying a new unit. Now I'm back to watching my five year old Emerson that I've never had any problems with.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: No internet connection
Review_Text: Bought this TV 11 months ago and the internet connection has broken down. The TV can find my internet but it cannot connect to it. This is my 2nd unit...the first unit couldn't even FIND the internet... TCL said the internet software was not loaded into the TV. I bought a warranty but cannot afford to mail unit to TCL for repairs.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: TCL 65 Unit failure
Review_Text: I bought a 65 TCL smart Tv that started failing within the first year, in the the eighth month the sound level couldn't be controlled. On a decibel meter it would go from 25db while watching a show to over 95db when a commercial would start, which causes hearing damage. Tried for four month to get C/S at TCL to fix the problem I performed their tests, restarts, updates and photos only to be told wait for a software update. TCL stalled service until the warranty expired and then wanted to send a tech why not months before. No resolution on frustrations from TCL. Buyers Beware
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: DO NOY BUY! ROKU error WON'T allow setup
Review_Text: Bought two of these on Wednesday. Right out of the box, they do not work. As soon as you get connected to the internet, it says it needs to update software. Then the error code pops up.  "The software update failed because of a temporary firmware server issue. Error code: 008." We tried all of the troubleshooting with tech support on an hour long phonecall. TCL ( TV mfg) states it is a ROKU issue. Our issue has been "escalated" and we should get an e-mail in a week. So glad this was not a Christmas present. So many were sold and I cannot imagine how many upset families will have presents that won't work.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Software Issues
Review_Text: The TV won't update and when you try and fix it either online or usb as instructed there is no model number that is recognized by ROKUs website. Conveniently you can't run any streaming services without the update. So now we just bought a "smart tv" that won't do anything but run our satellite box.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: I love it!
Review_Text: I have 2 55inch Roku

Title: On my second one. Both TVs failed in under a month
Review_Text: I purchased the 50" to start. In just under a month the black screen defect happened. I figured just unluck and exchanged for a 43 for a slightly better fit. Its only been 2 weeks with this one and there is a panel of pixels on the bottom that randomly flicker brighter and dimmer as if struggling to work properly. SEVERELY disappointed. I didnt expect a ton from this tv given the price, but both TVs failing in under a month is ridiculous. I will be returning and choosing a different tv altogether. Dont bother with this tv. Its a shame too, I love the Roku setup!

Title: Skeptical at first but absolutely LOVE IT!!!!!

I read a lot of different reviews on different TV's and this TCL 65" was always in the top 5....so I fought my fear and just bought it. I haven't had it that long but I will say it is awesome. Very easy set up. It connected to the internet, and I linked it with my Roku and other platforms all in less the 10 minutes. Very very user friendly and really...I can't say enough about this TV. I love it. Sound and Picture quality are excellent. I am sold on TCL TV's now.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Love my TCL but My advice is buy Protection Plan
Review_Text: I am in love with my TCL TV. The company is absolutely amazing. I have FIVE TCL TVs in my home. They work wonderfully, however, I'm hear to warn you. The Manufacturer does honor the one-year warranty with them. Walmart sells a Square-Trade Protection Plan. For the FIRST time ever My Favorite TV. The 65" inch lost it's picture. TCL helped me to troubleshoot it. (Press Home 5xs, Up 1x, Rewind Twice, Forward Twice-The TV Restarts itself or you can unplug and wait 60 seconds) The troubleshooting didn't work. I then went to use my Protection Plan. They said they'd mail me a Brand New TV but when I look at the email sent to me, they were giving me threw choices of TVs but NONE were TCL. I called them back. I demanded a TCL replacement. They said they would send me a new email so that I can choose a TCL model in the next few days. I will update my review. I just want to say that TCL TVs are the best and it's good to get the Protection Plan. It's worth it. So please purchase one.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Still happy with my purchase 6 months in.
Review_Text:
Pros: Decent picture quality, size and performance for the cost. Stylish design, looks great over my fire place. Easy to use Roku interface. 

Cons: Sound and video randomly unsync in certain sound modes. Its easily fixed by changing modes but still annoying. Can't pair with my iLive soundbar. Tried everything on the website. Had to buy a special cable to get it to work. Game mode still has a lot of input lag from an Xbox one X. Looks great though. 

Overall still a great value TV.

Title: none

Title: Great TV for a reasonable price.

Title: Best 75” TV out there for the price!
Review_Text: Like the title states, I looked for weeks and finally decided on the TCL 75” (75S421). I had it shipped to Wally World to save on the shipping cost. Just be forwarned, the box this came in was HUGE. It barley fit in the bed of my F150. The TV starts up fast and is very quick to go from app to app. I HIGHLY recommend using the Roku app for your phone, you can control everything with your phone, I mean EVERYTHING. Also, the app allows you to use your bluetooth headphones to hear without waking the baby. Oh and if you are not going to wall mount it, your TV stand needs to be at least 63” long and 16” wide (minimum). Anything less than those dimentions and it may not sit correctly and safely on your TV stand. Overall I am very happy with this purchase!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Good deal!
Review_Text: Great picture, sound, and overall quality! Definitely a good deal for the price. Only small issue we have with it is the power light at the bottom of the TV is really bright (we have it in our bedroom). Not a big deal, we will just have to cover it with something. Good price for a good TV!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Turns itself off
Review_Text: We bought a 55" several years ago. Liked it so well went back to Walmart and bought 2- 32" TV's for the bedrooms. Now Every single one of them turn themselves off in the middle of a show! Doesn't matter how long they have been on. Yesterday my 32" turned itself off 3 times in 45 minutes! No rhyme or reason to why or when this happens. And yes, I checked the sleep timer. It is off on all 3. I googled this problem and find out I'm not the only one! The 55" is getting so bad we are looking for another TV. These TV's are not that old! The last one is just a year old. 2 stars earns the good picture quality. Minus 3 for the aggravation!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: What's not to like?

I love how the cable box is a channel in the Roku menu. This thing is seriously simple to use. Now I'm almost annoyed that the LG in my living room is NOT built around Roku like this set is. Hopefully it lasts a while... but so far I'm blown away.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: GREAT TV! WORTH EVERY PENNY!

Title: Good picture quality for the price
Review_Text: I have this TV for a month so far. The color is good. Sound quality is good for voice but not good for music, which is understandable. You need to have a surround system for good music; sound bars are waste of money. Second day in after I have the TV, pictures turned black and white. I unplugged the TV and rebooted it. The pictures came back normal. For the price, so far so good. Here is my settings for a good picture quality. Picture mode = Normal TV Brightness = Bright Dynamic Contrast = off Backlight = 95 Brightness = 68 Contrast 71 Sharpness = 87 Color = 43 Tint = -4 Color Temp = Cool Game Mode = Off
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: HORRIBLE PICTURE

Title: Two TVs in two years malfunction
Review_Text: We first bought our 55" TCL Roku TV two years ago at Walmart. At first the tv worked great. The picture quality is excellent, and we love the Roku integration. The sound quality is a bit lacking though. Less than a year later all of the HDMI ports stop working, which means no game console or DVD players will operate. We put in a work order through TCL, and luckily it was still under warranty. After going through all of their steps over the phone to no avail, they sent out a technician with a new tv. Awesome! Well, here we are a year out from that, and last night the picture on the tv suddenly went black. The sound was still working, just no picture, and no backlight at all. Completely dark. We have unhooked and rebooked everything, rebooted, and even factory reset the tv. Still no picture. In my troubleshooting I have discovered this to be a problem with a lot of people, and issues have even been reported to the BBB. We have put in a maintenance request and are awaiting contact from a technician, but their website says there could be a wait due to Covid-19 issues. It seems that these tvs are built without demand for quality workmanship. A television should last longer than a year. If TCL does not replace this existing tv due to warranty issues, we will definitely not be buying another, and I would absolutely urge everyone to look at a different manufacturer when shopping for a smart TV.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Best bang for your buck!
Review_Text: I've just purchased this tv after my previous tv has went out. I've been doing my research on this tv for a while and I can honestly say this tv is your best bang for your buck . Most people that I've read about that do professional reviews has said it's great if your on a budget , it doesn't get to bright if your in a bright room , and picture quality diminishes the great the viewing angle is . Pros for me: Great size , picture is good, price is better Cons: Not the best quality when it comes to 4K I'd recommend this tv if your looking to upgrade and on a budget.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Do NOT buy

Title: Ok TV for the price
Review_Text: Picture quality was good, but the sound is way to low. You literally have to put it at 75 to hear it well but it’s understandable because it only has 10w speakers so it’s best to have it connected to a sound bar. The lack of 120 refresh rate is well display when watching live sports all you see is a blurry player running back and forth. But this isn’t a $1500 tv so you get what you pay for and in this care $700 is what you get. 4K content not so great the picture is dark and not as sharp as it should be, and after many adjustments same thing. Is this tv worth the purchase yes if you want low quality and a big size TV then yes. But if you are looking for a great 4K tv experience then no. You will be disappointed in the sound and picture quality. My suggestion is to wait it out save a few extra hundreds and but a better TV. I did return this tv and got a different brand and the difference is night and day.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Only One Complaint
Review_Text: First off I was shocked at how light this TV is and how easy the unboxing was. I like how it was boxed well and protected. Hook up and set up was fast and simple. It does have a cheap plastic feel to the TV and the remote is simple. Only having the main buttons required. I actually didn't like the remote. It is small, the volume up, down and mute buttons are located on the side of the remote. Anyone that has never had a Roku might find some of the buttons confusing. What I feel TLC focused on the most was the pitcher quality. It has an excellent 4K pitcher for the price. Still not full HDR though. Some of the bright sunny areas are bleached out. But not a major concern at this price. Kinda worried on the panel life at this price. You tend to get what you pay for. Only time will tell. You take good care of it and it will take care of you. Now to my only complaint. It doesn't come with the av pig tell adapter. Most TVs I've purchases in the past came with it. Not sure why this TV did not. So if you are one of the select few that still uses RCA's. This may not be the TV for you.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: TCL TV's have a new fan! Pretty impressed, so far!
Review_Text: Just bought a TCL 43" 4K 43S421 OPEN BOX to replace a just bought TCL 32" because it was a little too small (worked fine). The TV is going to be mainly used for Xbox and my son said the 43" was much clearer (not surprising 4K versus 720p) and faster. I decided to attach a small HD antenna just to see what would happen and was able to tune in the Patriots/Dolphins game and the picture was pretty darn good. I will try to hook up cable later (have to find the right cable wire) but it might be worth getting a real HD antenna as I found myself watching the game on that TV rather than the 1080 I have in the living room. I'll keep and eye on it and try to update this rating as it goes along.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: I reccomend it!!!

Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: A lot of features for the money
Review_Text: This is not your parents' TV. In fact, if you haven't bought a TV in a few years, it's not your same old TV either. With great power comes great confusion. There are so many bells and whistles it will take a while to set this up. Before even plugging it in, I discovered that while the feet on it look symmetric, they are not, They have a definite front and back, and there are little tabs on the bottom of the frame to force the alignment. Once I plugged it in I found that I had to have my smart phone handy to sign up for (sign in to) a Roku account (free) and to log into my Amazon Prime account in order to access both of those features. Things were going well until I tried to watch TV from my cable box. The screen went all green. I tested all three HDMI ports with the same result from that and my DVD player. The one common element was the TV. Watching content from the internet was fine. In fact, an excellent picture. I was ready to box the TV up and take it back, but after messing around again the problem went away. We will see if it comes back. If not, I will be totally satisfied with this TV. I had considered getting a 65" model, but decided it was just to big for my space. This replaces an 8 year old 55" TCL that developed a pixel width vertical black line. I paid less than half for this TV than I did for my old one. If you are not tech savvy then you better find someone who is to help you set this up. And be sure to have your smart phone handy and know the password to your WiFi. Good luck and enjoy.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: none
Review_Text: This was a great deal. I paid $265 with a 3 year warranty $318. I usually purchase online and pick up from the store. A week later, they had a 65 inch for $298 in the store. I wanted to scream. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase and Walmart services.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: TCL 55, purchased twice both defective, get the Hi
Review_Text: Bought 2, both defective as it pertains to capacitors when hooked up to a cable tv box. Especially DVR function and when using On Demand, fast forwarding or rewinding picture will result in a shot of static through the speakers when starting /stopping the function. Especially bad going backwards. Note, this does not occur when using the smart function of the TV, only when hooked to cable. I tested the box, changed out the coaxial, checked all HDMI ports. Both TVs exhibited the same issue and both have been returned. Important, to confirm this was not an isolated occurence I purchased the second TCL 55 inch at a different big box store. Same issue. The goods news is I have found success with a 55 inch Hi Sense that meets the same price criteria I had budgeted. Very pleased with the Hisence, all functions work the way their supposed to. Also, for the knuckleheads that keep posting reviews that these TVs force you to pay for a Roku account, they do not. You can set up an account free of charge and the app streaming from the Roku feature is superior over what you will get on a higher end TV such as a Samsung.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great T.V considering the price.
Review_Text: To start off the picture quality of this T.v is amazing. Now don't get me wrong its not a Samsung but for gaming this T.v really looks great. The 4k is clear and the HDR looks great once you set it up. Only downsides to this are that the glare isn't that great when the sun from windows hit it and you need to set the HDR on your t.v to automatic with the Roku phone app in advanced settings for it to not look washed out. Just Google how to and you'll be fine. It runs cool compared to my old Vizio that I had which is always a nice bonus since the PS4 Pro can heat up a tad when using the HDR on the Television. Overall the price is great when you look at how good the picture looks and it sounds. But keep in mind I use it for gaming and am unsure how Cable or movies might look at it since I know the PS4 version of Netflix is made to work a bit differently.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: A former Samsung TV guy isn't going back.
Review_Text:
We've had Samsung TVs for the longest time and recently needed to replace our main TV due to a new piece of furniture. After some research and my frustration with Samsung's approach to forced upgrades (3 year old TV no longer downloads latest apps), I decided to look around for somewhere to see the TCL side by side with other TVs.
After hearing some horror stories about people receiving cracked TVs from Amazon, I decided to head over to Walmart... their online price was comparable to what Amazon was offering. After flicking around with the very simple remote, navigating the menus, and seeing the picture quality, I selected the 65” unit. Much to my surprise, it being Super Bowl Sunday, the TV was even less than I was prepared to pay.
Now setup, and regularly being used by everyone in the family, I can say that if the TV lasts, TCL, and the Roku platform has a new customer willing to highly recommend.
My only wish was that the Dedicated App buttons on the remote could be reprogrammed. Otherwise, this TV rocks.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great TV for the price and more
Review_Text: I purchased the 55inch TV because my previous 75inch panasonic went out. I honestly did not need a size bigger than 55inch. The price I paid for the TCL was super affordable but I was not sure the TV itself would meet the expectations I had previously with my old tv. Man was I wrong, the quality is great on the TCL. It's very easy to navigate. My 3 and 4 year old can easily navigate also. I love the parental control too. Roku is very integrated. I honestly thought I would have needed to purchase a sound bar, but I was wrong. The TV sits about 50 feet away from the couch and the quality is spectacular. I like the different audio/picture modes. I usually alternate between normal, theater and music modes. Love the TV. I will follow up next year to let you guys know if i feel the same. I'm sure I will. Thanks guys!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Have two of them now
Review_Text:
Good bang for the buck - bought one of the TCL 55" Ulrta 4k tv's from costco to replace an old off brand tv got years ago for the bedroom. Already used to using the Roku so the remote and interface was familiar and easy to set up.
Xfinity/Comcast has a streaming app that allows you to hook up (I think) 5 devices - works great with this tv - really slick, hang it on the wall, plug it in, 250+ channels immediately good to go - no cables to mess with, makes for clean install.
Was in Walmart to pick up a monitor and saw this one on sale for a really good price, already familiar with the tv and needed one for the guest room so no-brainer grabbed it and was up an running in less than 1/2hr and that includes mounting on the wall - really makes things easy.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Cannot best the price/quality!

There 4-series is awesome and the 5-series is amazing! I will be a forever TCL owner! Best TV brand EVER!

Title: Great Picture and Features for Cord Cutters!

It is perfect for cord cutters like us. 4K UHD is affordable with TCL, even our 65" was unbeleviably affordable. GREAT PURCHASE. Don't hesitate, buy one of these TV's and cut the cord!

Title: Buy at your own risk
Review_Text: I spent $400, plus tax, for this particular TV, less than 3 years ago and now it won't even turn on with the remote control. To power the TV on and off, I literally have to keep plugging it in and unplugging it. Also, after I do plug the TV in, the screen just continually fluctuates between a red, TCL Roku homescreen and a completely black screen. I called TCL customer support and they had me try several different things, unsuccessfully I might add. Then, they basically told me that my TV was trash but I could take it to a repair shop. Give me a break! Why would I wanna spend another 2 to 3 hundred dollars, to fix this piece of crap, TV?

I would recommend this TV to anyone and everyone who visits me loves the picture!

Title: Great for about 8 months.
Review_Text: Dont buy but if you do and you start noticing that you have to reset the tv or restart it because the screen saver gers stuck on, take it back right away. I didnt i kept fooling with it likr its something i did. Actually when you reset itit eorks fine. Until sy your show ends or something causing the tv to go to screen saver mode. Then its stuck again. 13 months after my purchase black screen. One month past warantee and they told me to pound sand. Im trying to buy replacement boards instead of throwing away 600 bucks. I got one set from ebay. The main board and power supply matched but the thitd card did not. Do ive irdered another set for 60 bucks which include every board inside the unit. If they dont work it eill cost me 10 bucks shipping but they will take them back. Then what do i do with a 600 dollar piece of cheap plastic. Idk go ob youtibe a d find a diy for making a ceiling light out if the leds. Listen befire you buy dont be dazled by the great picture. Yes it is good. But squeeze the frame. Its so cheap. I guarantee the components used on the pcbs gotta be made so cheep. There are differences in caps and resistors and everything elde inside. Ill tell you the difference, i fell 8 feet iff a deck with my iphone in my hand. Thank Gid the iphone hit the back side. Only a littke scratch in the back im pretty sore. I wonder what would hsppen if my tv dripped 8 feet. But thats the difference in a 1500 dollar iphone xs and a 600 dollar tcl . Im going back to viseo or lg. Ive gots some older tvs still working great. I bought new because i wanted 4k but if it dint wirk ehats the dufference . Sorry to be negative. Usually i try to find the best in a product. This was a sad ripoff. In the meantme im watching my old tv till something happens . Thanks
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Good value

Title: JUNK!!!!
Review_Text: I loved this TV when I first bought it. The picture was clear and the sound was great. But after about 5 months, it just stopped working. I was in the middle of watching a movie when the screen went black all of a sudden. I thought it was a glitch in the movie, so I waited a little while, then tried another channel.... but there was still nothing but a black screen. There was sound, but no picture. So I turned it off, then back on but it didn't help. I unplugged it for a while and plugged it back in, but that didn't help either. I noticed that the picture was just barely visible when I looked at the screen from the side of the TV... but it was still completely dark when I looked directly at it. After a few days, I turned the TV on and not only was the screen still black, but the sound had stopped working too. I've been unable to get a refund or get the TV fixed so unfortunately, I'm stuck with this piece of junk. Buying this TV was the equivalent to flushing $500 down the toilet. I am extremely unhappy.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Works easily and flawlessly

Title: WONT TURN ON
Review_Text: so...I bought the 4 series a few weeks ago. two weeks later it started not turning on. so, I unplugged it and plugged it back in. This helped for two days. Then it wouldn't come on at all. I did the reset, and the hold down the power button for 15 seconds. Which is located behind the TLC logo and plastic piece at the bottom of the TV. nothing. I called TLC tech support. the number is on the side of the TV. The woman asked if I had it connected to a Serge protector. no... so, I thought what the heck and connected the TV to a Serge protector. It is now working. I don't understand why, but the TV couldn't have direct current. I told the woman it seemed to be the power cord. TLC is sending a new power cord. Hope this helps others with this problem. It is very frustrating. I will say this, tech support was very helpful and very understanding of my frustration.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: DO NOT BUY. Infamous black screen issue.
Review_Text: I guarantee the people writing these reviews havent had their TV's long. The tv went black and and stopped turning on. Wouldnt you know it, its 7 months later and the EXACT same thing is happening again. I got online, starting with the BBB, and this happens to a ton of people, it is well known and they still sell these TVS. DO NOT BUY THESE. They rarely make it to the 2 year mark. This is practically a scam. They KNOW about this famous black screen issue.

Title: AVOID THIS UNLESS YOU HAVE MONEY TO THROW AWAY!
Review_Text: AVOID THIS UNLESS YOU HAVE MONEY TO THROW AWAY! The TV at first was too good to be true. At the time of purchase, 4k, was a thing that only certain people could invest or make the switch to. Well, TCL was giving me the opportunity to switch, and at a price that was very questionable. So just like others, I fell into the trap. I purchased the 65' 4k TCL TV thinking this would give my living room some flare. It did until one normal day, the entire screen went black. So I did a factory reset and then it turned on like normal. BUT it wasn't normal. Some of the pixels on the screen never managed to ignite. I reached out to TCL's customer service thinking TCL will fix my problem because most companies stand behind their product, right? Wrong again. TCL asked me for the serial number and told me that since the pixels was slightly spaced apart, they couldn't help me. Overall, the customer experience was okay, at least they added a little bit of empathy when delivering the bad news. Me, This Guy, will NEVER buy another TCL product again. I purchased a Samsung Qled since. Whats the saying, buy once, cry once? Well spend your money wisely. If you have the ability to save and purchase the main thing you'll see for a few "years" at a time, buy a better brand. PRO: Price and they also teach their customer service reps on how to use empathy. CONS: EVERYTHING ELSE I would add photos but id probably be petty and add ones of my Samsung.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Screen Went Black after 2 Years...
Review_Text: We bought the TV in June 2017. In Oct. 2019 the screen started to be black every once in a while and we had to turn it on and off to get the screen to come on. It would power up but the screen was black. Long story short---within two months we could not get the TV to turn on. Where I come from a $400 TV (at that time) should last more than two years. I see it is much cheaper now, so maybe worth taking a chance. Ours was a year beyond warranty. Clearly a defect but nothing we could do. Actually was a good TV until then but first time we EVER had a television give out before we replaced it.
