Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Roku TV Review
Review_Text: This is my first experience with a smart tv. Over all I really like it. It is a good screen size, has good picture quality, and has excellent sound. Some things you need to know- The front of the box shows 2 remotes. You only get one remote. It is the Roku remote. The big draw back here is there are no numbers on the remote so you can't just punch in a channel number. You have to scroll thru all the channels. Not a big deal if you have antenna tv and only have 30 or so channels. But even then it is aggravating. So if you have satellite and have over 300 channels it is going to be aggravating when you are on channel 23 and need to scroll to 240. Another thing I do not like is the TV picks your favorite channels for you. Those channels are then put separate from the other channels. So if you are on channel 27 and want to go to 29 and it has picked 29 as a favorite for you (it chooses them by how often you watch them) then when you scroll up through the channels it goes 27, 28, 30. Number 29 is taken out and put in your favorites. So you have to scroll back to the first to access the favorite channels. You do get an on screen tv guide even with antenna tv. So that is a good thing. I had to call support to get some help setting the TV up. You will be talking to someone in another country but the lady talked to was really nice and really helpful even though at times extremely hard to understand. You do not get any kind of book with the tv. I guess you are suppose to just go online. I could not even really find any type of owner manual. You get a folded up paper that is a set up guide with the TV. Most questions I have had I either googled or sent an email. Sending an email has been my best communication. They always have answered. I would recommend this TV and if I wanted another large screen or smart tv I would go with Roku. I have also recently learned the tv (being hooked to the internet) basically does spy on you. It knows what dvds you watch. I guess that is not a big deal. My computer knows what websites I visit. So it is no different. I did not realize this was happening until I popped an old dvd in and a disclaimer pops up apologizing because the show was from long ago and may be offensive. It was a Tom and Jerry cartoon. smh This model does not have a camera nor does it have a microphone. You can't just tell the tv to go to this or that channel. The TV literally has thousands of apps you can download. Some you need a subscription for and you will pay for it. Some are free. Or they have free stuff and things you can pay for. Roku also has a channel that has tons of free stuff on it as well. You also do not have to connect a credit card to your Roku to be able to have a Roku account. And you will need one to use the TV. There is a way to bypass that when you set up the account. You may need to contact support for help. Having the CC already connected make is easier if you plan to purchase a lot.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: GOOGLE "TCL black screen problem"
Review_Text: These tvs (55-65 in) are great picture performers, especially for the price. That's the hook. UNFORTUNATELY, THEY ARE FAILING LIKE CRAZY. TCL BECAME POPULAR IN WINTER/SPRING 2017. IF YOU SIMPLY GOOGLE THE BLACK SCREEN ISSUE ,YOU WILL SEE AN UNGODLY NUMBER OF REPORTS OF FAILURES BETWEEN YEAR 1 (END OF WARRANTY) AND YEAR 2. It starts like this: intermittent black screen with audio that seems to fix itself. ***Countdown to worsening intermittent failure has begun. It will progress to a point that you need to unplug or factory reset it to bring it back. ***Countdown to imminent complete failure has begun. COMPLETE FAILURE: WILL REQUIRE T-CON BOARD AND/OR POWER BOARD REPLACEMENT AND/OR POSSIBLE LED STRIPS. IF YOU ELECT TO REPAIR, IT IS AT YOUR OWN RISK OF IT SIMPLY HAPPENING AGAIN AS THE PARTS ARE NOT UPDATED TO STOP THE ISSUE (TCL doesn't even acknowledge the failures are happening). Keep in mind the pricing for TCL has dropped 1/3 -1/2 of what they were just 2 years ago. So odds are, unless you are willing and able to repair it yourself, you will wind up simply replacing the TCL tv (but hopefully not with the same brand. At least until they learn to take care of the buyers that gave them a chance and got burned 13-24 months after purchase). In my case, 65s405 / 23 months / $900 WASTED. JUST GOOGLE IT. They were too new for the problem to show itself back then. THE INFO IS AVAILABLE NOW.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: INOPERABLE/ BLACK SCREEN
Review_Text: I purchased this TV on 7/17/2018 and after a few months we started noticing discoloration within the screen. Some areas were lighter in color and some areas were tinted no matter what application/ movie/ show we were watching. Last week my daughter was watching the TV when the screen flickered and then turned black. Audio was still present but no picture. I did a complete reset using the button on the side, I did not work. I did a flashlight test on the screen and sure enough there was obviously an issue with the LED lighting. I called customer service for assistance and the rep said to take it and get it repaired as the warranty was no longer valid. She chuckled after I stated that would cost almost the purchase price of the TV! We have since purchased a Samsung class 4K UHD and the PICTURE IS CRYSTAL CLEARâ NIGHT AND DAY THE CLARITY OF THE TCL! The TCL Picture quality is pale in comparison to the Samsung! I did enjoy the ease of using a ROKU TV but I will NEVER purchase another TCL product.... EVER especially after seeing hundreds of reviews with people experiencing the SAME issue. The price point is extremely reasonable and that and the positive reviews on Best Buy promoted its purchase, but sadly I have learned the hard way... you get what you pay for!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Worthless if connected exclusively via internet
Review_Text: Continually drops internet connectivity. Purchased for streaming and I have 400 mps which comes through at that rate both modem and router, but the best the tv has ever gotten is less than 80 even though it's close to router. Undaunted, I purchased Cat8 cables and connected directly - still no increase. The worst is that it continually drops even though the System setting shows it's connected. Others have had the same issue. I can test via Android phone and Windows laptop with no drop in speed or connectivity. Being a "smart" tv makes it worse as the only way to reset is to go through the large menu to get to power shut off/restart. Often have to reboot modem just to get tv to reset even though other devices are still connected. It will state a good connection when it's not really connected - Have to system/set up connection, it says it' good to go, but go to system/check connection and it's not working. So far it's slower than using my phone's nternet even when i've exceeded data so it's been throttled - that's how bad it is.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: This TCL TV is a defective product, do not buy!
Review_Text: The TCL ROKU 55" TV is a faulty product with a manufacturing defect that causes the backlights to shut down quickly and without notice. I purchased this TV for $349 in November, 2018 and immediately had it professionally hung on my wall. Had settings use a "flashing time" screensaver with intent to maximize lifetime of my product. Also purchased Roku Surround Sound speakers which I wirelessly attached to the TV for $149 - these worked great, but are useless until I purchase a new TV. Came home in January, 2020 to a black screen. When you power the TV on, it shows a 1 second flash of the red "TCL * ROKU TV* screen, then nothing. Audio works when using the remote to adjust the volume. Tried powering off then on, then unplugging and waiting, finally attempted a factory reset per TCL's "troubleshooting" instructions. None worked. I could faintly see the visuals that are supposed to appear when holding a flashlight to the TV. TCL does not care or attempt to engage me with a solution to this. Their position is that I should have purchased a longer rebate with the retailer than the 1 year warranty that comes with the product. Mind you, I've spent $500 plus tax only FOURTEEN MONTHS ago on this product that has been kept in mint condition. If this backlight issue happened after 7 years, or even 5, I'd have accepted that. But TCL puts out products that offer an unacceptably short life. This is a manufacturing defect, not the fault of the retailer! I've searched this issue on Google and found a disturbingly high number of people with TCL product issues similar to mine. Bringing it to a TV repair shop will cost over 50% of the cost of the TV, with no warranty of future success if fixed. There are at-home TV repair kits for sale for $60 plus shipping and accompanying YouTube videos that are mindblowingly complex on fixing motherboards, "T-Con boards" or the LED lights. In short, I have a huge, useless black screen in my living room until I buy a new one and pay also for IT to be professionally hung. TCL = faulty products, awful customer service and no fair solutions. Buy a more reputable brand!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: TCL 65" HDR Roku Smart TV - Is A Great TV!!
Review_Text: I purchased the 65" Hisense TV.. When I turned it on, it had red spots in the screen that wouldn't go away. Walmart refunded my purchase. I didn't want to take a chance on the Hisense again, so I purchased the TCL 65" HDR Roku Smart LED TV (652425).. Boy am I glad I did.. It has features that the other didn't have.. First it has a great picture, it up scales TV and Movies to near 4K quality. (But Not every one of them). It is also has a 120 frame rate instead of the 60 that many of them have. This gives you an image easier on the eyes. Of course if you want to be a cable cutter. There is plenty of free TV and Movies.. In addition to the Roku channel. You want to install Pluto. Pluto has free TV and Movies.. You have to register your email with them following their instructions, however it is worth it for the over 100 live free stations that you can flip through with your remote just like having cable TV, and it also has a Movie section that you can go to. There are other free Movie Apps that you can find by doing a search. But Pluto is our favorite of them.. Hope this review helps.. It is a great TV for the price..
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Roku trapped us into paying more

I was very upset when I called them and they told me I had to pay MORE money for our TV to be unlocked after we had just spent $500 on it. I would not recommend getting any roku unless you intend to pay more. Title: Best Tv for price
Review_Text: I did a lot of research before buying this TV, read online reviews from different sites, compared this TV against others similar to it in stores and came to the conclusion that this one by far had one of the best pictures and sound and had the the best price for an entry level TV of this type. Once I bought and got it home I was able to mount on my TV stand by myself (not that heavy) and setup was a breeze, just follow on line instructions. The only drawback I have found so far is this TV did not come with an owners/users manual had to search online to find one. With that aside I do recommend this TV to anyone that is looking to upgrade to a 4K and larger TV, you want be disappointed.

Title: Genuinely impressed
Review_Text: So, maybe I have poor vision, because I had a bunch of people tell me that this wasn't "good 4K" picture, but when I got it home, this is hands down the best picture of any TV I've ever owned. It's crisp, bright, and mesmerizing. I've always deemed 4K unnecessary, so I've never thought about getting one. My family still uses box TVs and this is the first 4K we've ever had it is awesome. Title: Highly reccomend!
Review_Text: I recently purchased a 65" TCL ROKU tv. And I must say , it has been the best decision for us! From unboxing to sitting down to watch a movie on amazon prime , took all of 30 minutes. Ease of use and picture/sound quality is amazing for the price! The most difficult thing was learning the remote , but we caught on quickly. It is super lightweight , yet sturdy. Title: Great TV with lots of options
Review_Text:
TV has everything you need to break free from cable/internet services if you have a hotspot with your phone coverage. Title: The picture is great but the sound sucks
Review_Text: We selected this TV based upon the price and picture quality. The sound was turned off at the store. The picture is really good and you can't beat the price. However watching TV on this set is like being deaf. The ROKU interface has only a few sound settings and I spent a hour looking for another adjustment in the user interface. We have a water fountain on our deck and if you leave the screen door open you can not hear the TV even with the sound at MAX volume. Some people online claimed the defect was due to a recent firmware update. If that were true than the company is lame for not fixing the firmware. It costs them very little to "tweek" the firmware and would improve the quality of the TV immensely . Now I need to buy a sound bar to make the TV "usable". I wish I had not bought this TV.

Title: TCL is the get it right the first time choice.
Review_Text: TCL makes THE best affordable 4k tvs in its price range. Picture quality, color and crispness @ 60hrtz does not disappoint. This tv never failed, never glitched and I never felt I needed to do something to get more out of it such that I felt I needed a better tv. It does well what it's designed to do out of the box. I recently sold my 43" TCL 4 SERIES, to buy a 5 series 50" with the Dollby vision. A lovely upgrade. It sold in under twenty-four hours, and was in perfect condition. I was proud to sell it and represent that the tv would not disappoint my buyer. TCL is certainly the best budget choice that comes with no issues in the design and picture quality. Start up is always fast, color and crispness is calibrated such that it requires little if any tweaking out of box. Set up with WiFi is fast and simple. 3 HDMI ports are enough to start with. Roku platform works as expected. This is a no headaches tv. The same is like true of all TCL TVs. Turn it on and it simply works. This tv does not do 120hrtz soap opera effect. Brightness is decent. Color is quite good, but remember the 4 series is not a higher end Dolby Vision tv, so you won't get that extra color range you would easily notice in tvs that have it. Sound quality is good but not great so...you know what to do. Headphone jack is on the right side. If you're on a budget or need an inexpensive get it right the first time 4k tv, don't dally, get a TCL ROKU TV.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Sound Problems
Review_Text: On day two we had problems with the sound. Initially an 'echo' followed all speech and other sounds delayed by 2 or 3 seconds. After trying many audio settings the 'echo' subsided somewhat but not completely but the voices did not synchronize with lip movement. I found no feature that would restore voice/picture synchronization. That condition remained until I returned the TCL to Walmart and selected another brand. I searched the internet for "TCL Sound" issues and found a large blog where many buyers complained of the same problems I had. I would not recommend this brand.

Title: Don't buy TCL TV or the Product care plan!

So far I am at 3 weeks of hearing "Someone will contact you in 1-3 business days", but they never call!! So here I sit with NO TV (the repairman left with it) and no word from anyone about replacing it. Customer Service is terrible. Walmart Corporate doesn't care either! Title: What you need to know about this tv
Review_Text: I've only had the tv less than a month and that's why it only gets 4 stars. Here's what you need to know to save yourselves some grief and frustration. First get your tv where you want it in your house. DO NOT PLUG IT IN YET. Adjust it so viewing is good. The next thing you need to do is set up a Roku account. Don't add a credit card, you can skip that part. Sometimes on tablets and phones you can't see you can skip that part. I used my laptop. Once you get signed in stay signed in. Now plug in your tv. You will go thru the setup including getting your wifi password on the tv. You will see the code to enter to activate your tv, the address will look something like this roku.com/link or something similar. Remember you're still signed in to roku, don't sign out. go to the roku address provided and add your code. Your tv will get activated. If you try to do without being signed in to roku it won't work. Well it didn't work until I signed in. That's my experience and I hope this helps. Good Luck.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: screen cracked after 6 months
Review_Text: purchased this tv and loved it for 6 months. One morning I turned it on and there's lines through the screen and a big white line on the side. I called TCL and their rep tells me that the screen has a crack in it and something hit the screen. This is impossible since it is mounted on the wall and the only time it is touched is when I need to turn it (its on a mounting bracket). Basically she said there was nothing they could do since the screen is not included in their limited warrantee. I'll look for a different brand next time.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great TV for the value!
Review_Text: I'm very impressed with this TV for the value! The picture is great, and I think I picked the perfect size for my set up. The apps are set up well so that they are easy to find, and you can customize which ones you want to be prominent on your home screen. As an avid Netflix/Hulu user, I also like that there are buttons for those 2 apps on the remote. I only have 2 issues—there's a delay the first time you click a button when the TV first comes on, it doesn't work until the second click; the WiFi takes a reasonable delay to connect when first starting—sometimes to the point of going into the settings to fix it. However, neither are terrible issues that would stop me from repurchasing.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great picture quality, however...
Review_Text: The picture quality deserves 5 stars if you're sitting directly in front of the tv. However, the picture dims considerably when just a few feet away. Also, motion is distorted when watching sports or fast-moving objects. Otherwise, it's a good tv at a very affordable price.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: CL 43" Class 4K Ultra HD (2160P) Roku Smart LED TV
Review_Text: Picture is ok for the price. This was for a guest room, so wasn't that concerned if picture wasn't perfect, but it's decent. So easy to set up, I'm a great grandma, and I did it with no problem. Sound is not great, but ok. For this price you can't expect a Samsung.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Free Roku Is Not True !!!!
Review_Text: The built in Roku is a joke about no cost activation. Tried several times and it always said Error call this number. When I called the number it would say "password does not match". When I got to speak to a live person I could not understand them. Later in the day tried one more time and finally got someone I could sort of understand. Bottom line it cost me $95.56 thru Caligeeks/caroline to get my TV to work. This info. should be in all ads that you will have to pay to get the Roku to work. So far the TV appears to work fine. I bought this one because it had the Roku built in. The cost ended up being about what you would of paid for a Roku Ultra set up. Was going to send this complaint to Walmart but couldn't find a way to do it. Think twice before you buy a TV with built in Roku.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Beware of what you are buying.
Review_Text: Beware, The TV on dislay in the store is not the one you will get when you unbox yours. I bought mine from the Wal-Mart locared at 990 Missouri Ave. N. in Largo, FL 33770. The one on display has a glossy screen with an excellent picture, when you unbox yours you will find it has a dull matte finish screen which does yeild as sharp and crisp picture as the glossy screen. I brought this to the attention of the manager of the store and was told that is was not their fault, as TCL ships them models to be displayed in plain brown boxes that may not be exactly the same as what you are buying.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: 4K titles
Review_Text:
Amazing TV for the price. I was looking to update my current set up, and move into 4K. While doing research, TCL kept coming up as one of the better, cheaper options for 4K.
I went with the 55 inch set, and couldn't be happier. It was easy to set up, and everything just worked. There's enough settings to fine tune the picture to how you like it. And the image is very sharp, and very clean.
Running something in native 4k, is amazing. Highly recommend it. And the Roku features, are just an added bonus.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great TV
Review_Text: Love this tv. This model does not come with the voice remote/wifi remote, but guess what, thats a good thing. The wifi remotes eat batteries and often lose connection. This has the traditional ir remote which works perfectly. Finally I can ROKU with a sleep timer too! Used to the roku sticks which offer no sleep timer. Picture is great, sound is better than expected. Nothing I don't like about it
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Dead After One Hour of Use
Review_Text: Got it home, turned it on, set it up, and watched it for one hour before BZZZT! Dead, won't turn on. Called TCL support, ran through the troubleshooting, and they agree. Looks like I'm headed back to Walmart in the morning to return it. Not sure I'll try another TCL though.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Excellent choice
Review_Text: We have been enjoying the S55421 for almost a year. The setup was simple. It's basically logging in to the WiFi and a registration process. Within a few minutes, done. There are advanced controls for color if you want to experiment or have specific needs. Otherwise, the presets are just fine. Since budget was a concern, I compared specs carefully to see what the trade-off would be. The picture is great so I don't see that anything was sacrificed. We added a soundbar for more robust audio. One caveat, unless the TV is wall-mounted, pay attention to the height of the soundbar. Our Yamaha system is just tall enough to block the remote signal unless you aim down from a high angle. Not a real problem, though. I'm a big fan of the Roku platform. Combined with the excellent quality of the set, it is a great choice.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: The TV that everyone has been waiting for is final
Review_Text: Since I got the TCL Roku TV I am now closer to being able to get ready of the cable box. I like the fact that it came internet capable that is probebly one of the greatest features that the TV comes with in my opinion. The free channels are great and the ability to get movies without a ton of issues, because the line up of movies is just what is needed,

Title: Don't Buy This TV
Review_Text: I purchased this TV Nov 1 2017. Great picture and features right out of the box. About 1 year and a half later, the television randomly loses video--sound on, black screen. Try to reset, sometimes the picture comes back, sometimes not, sometimes the next day. Many of the comments here and and online raise the same issues. Google "TCL Roku TV screen goes randomly black." Although this TV is low-priced, it shouldn't be having performance issues inside of five years. When considering the low price, factor in the cost of replacing the TV every two years.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: BEST Darn budget TV for your buck!!!
Review_Text: Purchased this bad boy on 10/16/19 in store and have not been able to stop smiling since. The setup was very easy and straightforward, it also has a very neat profile on my entertainment system with the TV mount. I was a little skeptical about TCL at first, as I was upgrading from a 11 year old LG flat screen dinosaur. But given the crisp audio and beautiful picture quality, I am more than satisfied with my purchase. One review stated that there was problems with the sound. Thus far, I haven't had any issues with that but I prefer to use a sound bar, so that make it null and void. So hey, if you are looking for a TV that won't break the bank but can roll with brands such as: LG, Samsung or Sony, look no further than TCL.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: none

Title: Great picture, even better value!
Review_Text: I've had this television for almost a year now and feel compelled to write this review. First, this TV is cheaper now than when I bought mine, so it is an even better value. What I must share is how brilliant the picture is! Depending upon broadcast quality, when the signal is truly a 4K broadcast, the picture is nothing short of amazing! The light weight of the unit allows it to be mounted just about anywhere. It is so slim that it fits tightly to the wall as well. Having ROKU built in is also a convenient feature. If there is any weakness, it would be the audio quality. However, most folks will add a sound bar, like I did, and the weak audio is a non-issue. All in all, this unit offers video quality far beyond its price range and great convenience. I'll buy another TCL when the time comes, but I don't expect that to be for quite a while.

Title: Packed up within 12 hours
Review_Text: As I started writing this review, I was standing in line at the Walmart Store Customer Service center to return this T.V . I have just shown the Representatives the pictures of the screen of the new television I just purchased. yesterday evening. Reason for returning the tv is that as soon as I got home yesterday, set it up, it worked until 10:00 pm.I went to sleep happy with the tv I had just purchased. Then I woke up this morning, got ready to leave the house, and just turned the tv on again for quick early morning news: and the screen started flashing these lines, intermittently. I thought perhaps it was just starting up. I turned it off and when I turned it on again, the same lines flashing. The rest of the screen was deep blue. Nothing showing and no audio. Just dead.I knew there and then that it was defective.....barely within 12 hours . I contacted Walmart, explained what I was seeing and was requested to return it for refund. Less than 12 hours of purchase. Maybe, the defect might be from the store packaging or from the device itself, I cannot tell. Well, I chose to have a replacement at the store, because I have heard so much good information about TCL televisions, that I am ready to give it the benefit of the doubt by taking a second TCL tv home. I hope the second one will redress the negative impression of the first purchase; and I may revise the review. But the only star in this Review is for the great assistance by Walmart staff....not for the television

Title: Roku Smart LED TV (55S421) --The good and the bad.
Review_Text: It looks very good, and the Roku interface has most of the features you get with a standard remote (once you get the hang of it). It also saves you from buying a Roku box if you were in the market for one. The Roku interface (just like with a Roku box) permits a great number of streaming apps and works very well. The TV will also do its best to present the correct aspect resolution for the channel content if it varies (480,760,1080 or 4K) when in Auto mode. Other settings are available. What is not too good is: - The 120hz for motion. Even when watching the news, the news person will blur a little as they move across the set. The faster they move the more they blur. I have not found a setting yet that will lessen the effect. The 4K does not seem to have the same issue. I think sports viewing like football might be a little too blurry at low resolution, but I have not tried it yet. - There is no way to just jump from one channel to another as you can with a remote with a number pad. But you can do switching between current channel and last viewed. - It seems to have no optical sensor for the rooms ambient light. That may be a good thing -- because my last TV had it and I had multiple settings for it anyway. The five preset settings can be reconfigured to remember your settings for each and thus can be used as brightness presets. - I wish the Roku remote had a few programmable buttons for other devices or apps. Overall a very good TV for the price. I paid $318. The 4K resolution is spectacular. And YouTube has a lot of 4K content. I also use an antenna (The usual auto programming) for TV reception and it works quite well, and gives a signal strength indicator for each channel. Switching between channels is done via a programming grid (displayed via the left arrow button), of simple up down selection using the up and down buttons. -Note: if you have a sound bar and the TV is on a table, then you will have to raise the TV up by about two inches to get the soundbar under the TV. It cannot be in front of it because it will block the TV's Roku remote sensor which is on the bottom center of the TV.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: DO NOT BUY
Review_Text: Stay away from TCL tvs. I bought a 55 inch and a 43 inch within months of each other. A little over a year later and both TVs screens went out. The 43 inch didn't even make it a year. If it had been one, I would just chalk it up to bad luck but it was both. If you call the company, they will tell you they only help you if your tv was bought within the last 364 days and you have a receipt to show them. Absolute trash tvs and the company does not stand by their products.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: none
Review_Text: I have had this tv for 3 years with ZERO problems. I dont use the wifi i use the wired internet and have no lag or problems. sound wise I use a sound bar but the tv speakers werent all that bad. picture quality and screen have been great. I googled best picture settings for this tv and dialed it in and it looks just as good as any other tv i have seen in friends or families house. maybe i got lucky but i have 4 tcl tv's in my house with no problems....Im sure sony and LG etc all have thier fair share of disgruntled customers who happened to get a bad tv. all the parts are coming from the same places its just the brand thats slapped on the box at the end.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: REMOTE DOES NOT CONTROL VOLUME.
Review_Text: Bought 9/30 for $298. Intallled ok. TCL did not control volume, mute, or DVR. Called support and tried a few codes but they did not work. Advised to call Spectrum. Spectrum tried several codes but said they do not have a code for the TCL. Now I have to use two remotes in order to control all features. Not good. Too soon to review other features but will advise later if any problems. Best feature so far is price.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Do NOT purchase this tv!
Review_Text: The tv great for awhile, but it began shutting off at random times. I bought this on 01-19-18 and as of last night it does not work anymore. Watching Netflix then all of the sudden it flickered off. Tried turning the tv on this morning and nothing. I don't smell any burnt wiring, but after 14 months the tv is not working. Of course it's outside it's warranty by a couple months! Grrr!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Stopped working in 10 months, TCL of no help
Review_Text: Worked great for 10 months, then all of a sudden one afternoon, screen worked . Contacted TCL support and here is their response verbatim: "Please be informed that the the panel of the TV consists of parts that are on the surface and inside of the screen. Therefore, there are cases wherein damages may not be visible on the outside, but are visible once the TV is turned on. With this, we encourage you to check with the retailer if they cover this type of issue with the TV. TCL reserves the right to exclude this type of damage from warranty claims as stated on the Manufacturer's Limited Warranty found on your TV's Manual"
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: none

Title: Would be a Great TV Without Roku
Review_Text: This Smart TV would be much better without the Roku interface. It was an annoyance to install and it is an annoyance every time the TV boots up. Otherwise this TV has a great picture. The remote control is a real looser too. It is very minimal and has no way to key in channel numbers. The sound and mute buttons are on the side and when using the remote one often accidentally hits the mute. I have 30 days to try it out. If I can live with its short comings I may keep it, otherwise it is going back for one without Roku. Just hope it holds up for many years.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Absolute garbage
Review_Text: Tv was good for a while,then the problems came. About 6 minths ago the tv started flashing a faint black section. Almsot half the tv would flash a transparent black,then back to normal. Wouldnt stop untill you changed the picture settings. Then it would go back to doing it a few days later. Then the opposite side of the tv went dark,then the whole thing went dark and no sound. Definitely would not reccomend this tv. Had it for barely 2 years,no we get to buy another one.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Dont Buy
Review_Text: I enjoyed this TV for about 10 months. The picture started becoming fuzzy and I had to factory reset the TV every couple days. 2 weeks of this and then it suddenly goes black. The backlight and audio worked, but the TV wouldn't turn on. TCL would not fix the problem without my receipt and Walmart would not give me a copy of the financial transaction. Went to Best Buy for a Samsung instead. I wont be buying a TV from either Walmart or TCL again.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great Value, Great Picture
Review_Text: I love this TV! I recently bought this TV in store and couldn't be happier. I had been keeping my eye on and was on sale so pulled the trigger. The TV was a breeze to setup, the Roku is easy to use and the picture is awesome! I will definitely be buying another TCL.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: TCL vs. VIZIO
Review_Text: I had both the TCL4 series 65" and a Vizio D series 65. The TCL has a brighter image and the ability to achieve rich colors without faces getting too red. The Vizeo has a better upconvert engine (old TV shows are surprisingly sharp) and excellent black uniformity and contrast....dark scenes really pop. I kept the TCL and returned the Vizio because the V made sunny summer scenes look gloomy or overcast. Even studio scenes like News broadcasts were not right, and when you up the color setting, faces get way too red. I couldn't give up the sunny day scenes. They both have their strong points for sure. Both are good, neither is perfect. Both require alot of adjusting to get the best picture. I can' t compare the sound quality or smart features because I don't use either.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Good for 1.5 Years
Review_Text: I had the TV since December of 2017. it was an awesome TV up until today. the motherboard went out and after speaking with TCL, they told me I had to either find a repairman or it was junk. If you are okay with throwing away a TV within two years, this is the TV for you. I highly recommend getting an additional warranty.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Important step for great picture
Review_Text: IMPORTANT STEP FOR BEST PICTURE! This is a budget TV and is not going to have the same picture as a $2000 Samsung. But set it up properly and you can get close. The picture may look blurry if you don't do this: Download the roku mobile app on your smartphone. Go to settings, go to expert settings (not avail on your TV settings), turn OFF Noise Reduction. I was about to return this TV until I did this. Huge difference! The picture is much sharper, more focused after this step. You can also use your phone as an enhanced feature remote after loading the roku mobile app. You're welcome!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: So happy i chose Tcl

Title: great TV great price

Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Great buy, but you get what you pay for
Review_Text: I have had this TV for about two weeks now, and overall, it has been excellent. I have loved the Roku TV ecosystem for some time now, and although I used to be cautious of the TCL brand, this TV has been serving me quite well. The picture has been fantastic, sound won't blow you away but there's nothing to gripe about for the price, and the smart TV abilities work without a hitch. If I had to pick one thing to choose one thing to complain about, it would be the backlight bleed. Darker scenes mixed with a low-light viewing environment will make it evident that the backlight isn't even across the panel. Given, if you're not looking for this kind of thing, you're probably not going to notice it. However, if it's something you care about, then you're probably going to be annoyed by it. Overall, this is a fantastic TV for the price, but keep in mind that you get what you pay for.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: No complaints!
Review_Text: I really didn't have very high expectations when I purchased this TV at this price point. I was wrong. I was so wrong that I purchased a second on, same brand with a larger screen, 50". The interface is well designed. The picture quality is amazing, much better than I expected. You can't go wrong with this TV.

Title: Lots of issues
Review_Text: We've had nothing but issues since we bought this brand TV(TCL 55US57 55" 4K Ultra HD 2160p 120Hz Roku Smart LED HDTV) a few years ago! I've never had this many issues with a TV before. First, the sound was messed up and would "jump" making the volume go really loud. It would not turn down after that, unless it was unplugged. That didn't always solve the issue either. Now, the screen is blinking on and off rapidly and needs a new backlight; I'm assuming. I will not be buying this brand again and do not recommend it to anyone looking for a new TV.

Title: TCL 55 ROKU TV
Review_Text: I purchased this TV less than 2 yrs ago, i really liked it until 2 days ago when it just stop working, i did all the troubleshooting the website said, but still nothing. Now im furious, i contacted customer support 2 days in a row, followed all there steps, still not working, i requested to speak with a supervisor, got Jacob who constantly keep telling my about the 1yr manufacturing warranty, i then asked for a manager, got Richard, explained to Richard im not going away and asked do TCL stand by there brand? Also informed them i would take all necessary steps to get this resolved because i am a consumer! I was asked take a picture of the TCL TV and my receipt of purchase and send to Richard, i did that tonight so i will be waiting to hear back from TCL within the next 48-72 hrs! hopefully Richard will get this resolved and i can update my review with good news!
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Okay if you're sitting directly in front of it!
Review_Text: The viewing angle is bad on this TV. You have to be directly in front of it for the best picture. This is mostly common for LED TVs, but this TV is the worst when it comes down to viewing angles. Try viewing this TV from an angle on the side (like a couch on the right or left side of the TV) and you'll notice the picture gets washed out and has a greenish tint to it. Viewing from these side angles isn't ideal at all! The sound of the speakers is okay. Its not good enough if you want a home theatre experience. Add a sound bar if sound is important to you. But good luck with that, as most sound bars won't fit well in front of this TV. They'll be too tall and block the bottom half of the TV. The picture quality is good when viewed directly in front of the TV. It shows it's HDR 10 compatible, but upon further research you'll notice this TV can barely be qualified as that. 4K resolution is okay, but you'll have to be close to the TV to notice any extra detail in the 4K content. I'd say if you're big into 4K, look for a TV with Dolby Vision for the best 4K picture. This model doesn't have it, but newer model TCLs do.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421

Title: Facts about TCL television
Review_Text: I just have to write this review because I researched extensively before I decided to step into the Walmart Store to buy this television. Finally, I walked into the Walmart store that fateful day with my spouse to decide for myself and of all the different brand names that I saw displayed in the store, these TCL televisons indeed were outstanding televisions among the rest we saw (including LG, Samsung, Vizio, Sharp...name them). I had to step into the store and personally saw different televisions on display and even with the normal Store Television Settings that make them brighter and all, the TCL beat them all like I said earlier in terms of clarity, picture quality and overall superior performance and quality appearance. I was immediately struck by the fact that the reviews I had been reading about the tcl tvs might not all be over-rated after all. We bought the tv. When I got home and set it up with Home Use setting, I noticed one thing: the clarity of the picture and the quality is still as outstanding as it was in the store. It is really amazing like other reviews say, and it has remained the same. My conclusion: the television cannot be beat even by the brand names, If you have the chance, pick it up. The reviews are truly correct. Another suggestion, step into any store (Best Buy, Walmart or Target ) and see the different tvs for yourself and see what I mean. And most of all, the Company stands by their product (I see how they quickly respond to customers in reviews) The reviews are true indeed. I was skeptical initially in my researches. But for a fact, TCL is a quality product. The Roku interface is great. The set up is a breeze. Connectivity and UHD dispays are awesome.; and yet I have just regular internet connection. I am enjoying this television so much. Like others have been saying, I am sure my next buy is TCL, that is if they don't jump the band-wagon of price increase in the future. TCL...just keep up the good old American quality product at socially reasonable price , like you do now. And I will always come back you can bet, as I have other kids rooms to put in tv's too.
Product: TCL 75" Class 4K UHD LED Roku Smart TV 4 Series 75S421
